questions.question_text:
Your company has recently deployed Dynamics 365 Finance.
You are currently establishing the location of work items.
Which two of the following work items are located in Accounts payable?
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Person and Organization can be used.
Person and Organization are party types. Vendors and Customers are some of the party roles
Person and organization are party types. so correct answer should be both
Correct. There are several party roles, and they can be assigned to both party types, person and organization.

Which of the following are party types that can be added to global and additional address books? Answer by dragging the correct options from the list to the answer area.

//IMG//

You need to consider the underlined segment to establish whether it is accurate.
To review who has been assigned the administrator role, you should use the Security duty assignments report.
Select `No adjustment required` if the underlined segment is accurate. If the underlined segment is inaccurate, select the accurate option.

discussion.content:
Role to user assignment is report to check for one role with all users. 

User role assignment is for all users for all roles. 

So answer is C 
B is a menu item. Security role access is menu item level.

Selected Answer: D
C is not the correct option because the Role to user assignments report does not show who has been assigned the administrator role. It shows the number of users assigned to each role, and the details of the role assignments. To review who has been assigned the administrator role, you need to use the User role assignments report, which shows the names of the users and the roles they have.

Selected Answer: C
Role user assignment is correct.

questions.question_text:
You are setting up Dynamics 365 Finance for a company started in the United States and Canada.
You are currently determining policy rules for purchasing. You need to make sure that personnel in the United States and Canada purchase from separate catalogs and suppliers.
Which of the following actions should you take?

choices.C: Set up category access policy rules.
choices.B: Set up purchasing policies at the legal-entity level.
choices.D: Set up purchasing policies at the organization level.

discussion.content:
B- Example 1: Simple purchasing policy configuration
Organizations that are small and less complex can set up purchasing policies by legal entity, and can use only the Companies organization hierarchy.

For Fabrikam, a small business, purchasing requirements vary little across the organization. Purchasing rules vary only among the organization's legal entities. For example, employees of Fabrikam Canada and employees of Fabrikam U.S. purchase goods and services from different catalogs and different vendors. Therefore, Fabrikam sets up its purchasing policies at the legal-entity level.

Selected Answer: B
B Legal entity level

Selected Answer: B
a legal entity is a company...organization means all legal entities

Selected Answer: B
Referring to the official website, B is correct

Selected Answer: D
B and D both are correct as in the purchasing policy form the list shows data entities and the list title is organization.

If I have to go with one answer, I would go with D

Selected Answer: B
B Is correct

comments.content:
I think B is correct. You do set up the puchasing policies at the 'legal entity' level. However, in dynamics, a legal entity is listed as a 'company' in the purchasing policies list:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/procurement/purchase-policies

discussion.content:
C- Category access policy rule
The category access policy rule determines which categories users have access to when they create purchase requisitions. If no rule is specified, all the procurement categories can be added to the purchase requisition.

Select the Include parent rule option to apply the category access policy rule of the parent organization to the category.
In the Available categories pane, select the categories that the rule applies to. When you select a category, all categories that are higher in the hierarchy are also added to the Selected categories list.
Select the Include subcategories option to apply the rule to all subcategories of the selected category.

Selected Answer: C
Category access policy rule solves this

choices.C: Set up category access policy rules.
choices.D: Set up purchasing policies at the organization level.
